abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Supplemental Financing
            for the Sixth Poverty Reduction Support Credit Project for
            Benin were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate; Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory; and borrower
            performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned includes: stated objectives and monitored results
            indicators need to be realistic and focused on indicators
            that are attributable to Poverty Reduction Support Credit
            (PRSC) supported actions. Some of the indicators in the
            series were situated at a level where attribution was
            difficult, if not impossible, and where a variety of
            exogenous factors weighed far more heavily on the
            achievement, or non-achievement, of results than supported
            actions. It is clear that policy actions are often not
            enough to effect significant and sustainable change. While
            specific policy actions may be necessary to create an
            environment conducive to change, additional enabling
            interventions are also frequently required. An additional
            lesson learned may be that a PRSC series will be more
            effective if the reform agenda supported by the series goes
            deeper rather than broader. In addition to including key
            policy actions in the operation, it may be beneficial if
            supporting actions, those related to implementation measures
            or second generation reforms associated with the initial
            policy action, are also included in the operation in order
            to ensure increased effectiveness of the initial policy
            action. Coherence across prior actions and triggers is also
            important to ensuring the effectiveness and sustainability
            of supported reforms. Prior actions and triggers should be
            designed as a coherent, mutually reinforcing package of
            reforms that together contribute to intended results rather
            than as a disparate number of individual actions each with
            its own individual targeted result. It is helpful if the
            provision of the credit/grant could be closely aligned with
            the budget cycle. The fiscal constraints imposed by
            declining and uncertain revenue streams required that
            expenditures and revenues be closely matched in order to
            avoid burgeoning budget deficits. The series benefited from
            significant donor cooperation and coherence and this
            mutually strengthened donor influence with the Government
            and allowed for more effective engagement with the authorities.
